thread.title: Last chance to get Glastonbury tickets in charity auction
thread.title_full: Last chance to get Glastonbury tickets in charity auction | West Country (E) - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Last chance to get Glastonbury tickets in charity auction
text:
People have one more chance to get their hands on tickets for Glastonbury 2016 - a special auction is underway to raise money for Oxfam’s Refugee Crisis Emergency Appeal.
The money will help Syrian refugees in Lebanon and Jordan.
Glastonbury Festival @GlastoFest Follow Bid now for one-off Glastonbury 2016 experiences (inc tickets) for @ oxfamgb 's refugee appeal http://t.co/2gWkxg2vaV http://t.co/aq5OsFhKKm
20:46 - 6 Oct 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite The auction, on the Oxfam Shop on eBay , starts today and ends on Tuesday 13th Oct.
What's on offer?
Entry for two to Glastonbury 2016 plus chance to watch set from Pyramid Stage Entry for two to Glastonbury 2016 plus chance to introduce an act on the Cabaret Stage Entry for two to Glastonbury 2016 plus chance to DJ at the Festival Entry for two to Glastonbury 2016 Festival entry plus Green Fields experience Entry for two to Glastonbury 2016 plus chance to press Arcadia Spider’s fire button Moons of Pilton art print, signed by Stanley Donwood Tour of Worthy Farm with Michael Eavis for two people (8.00pm) Moons of Pilton art canvas, signed by Stanley Donwood, Michael Eavis and Emily Eavis (8.20pm) Personalised Glastonbury 2016 oil drum bin (8.30pm) All 10 auctions had starting bids of £1 - but some lots are already going for over £2000
The plight of refugees who have left their homes due to fear and aggression has moved everyone in the Glastonbury Festival team and we want to do something to help.
– Emily Eavis, Glastonbury co-organiser She continued "We hope this auction will raise many thousands of pounds so that Oxfam, which has been a trusted partner of Glastonbury for many years, can deliver the support these people so desperately need"
It's not the first time the music festival has rallied to help with the refugee crisis:
Discarded wellies from 2015 were sent to people in Calais Last updated Wed 7 Oct 2015 Entertainment Somerset Glastonbury Festival
